repnme.cdata!: Pakistan - Punjab Forest Sector Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. Several lessons were
            drawn from the project, the most outstanding follows. The
            removal of subsidies on tree seedlings resulted in the
            emergence of a sizeable number of small private nursery
            operators, proving to be a profitable business to mostly,
            smallholders and the landless, who as a result of the
            project, are benefiting, though in a small measure, from
            employment opportunities. However, the role of
            nongovernmental organizations in social mobilization, needs
            to be built into the project design, demonstrated in the
            Thal and Pothwar areas, where mobilization succeeded by
            impacting on communities in rangelands, and scrub forests as
            set by the relevant component, an innovative effort
            undertaken during implementation. However, project design
            should be limited to achievable outcomes, where clear
            innovations, even with challenging tasks such as the above
            mentioned newly established nurseries, may prove successful
            without diluting the focus from implementation capacity. But
            required adjustments in implementation arrangements need to
            be addressed promptly, as they affect the pace of the
            implementation phase, and, timely recruitment of technical
            assistance needs to be ensured, to avoid implementation
            delays. The absence of appropriate training hindered
            capacity development in forestry research, i.e., the tissue
            culture research would continue to be constrained due to
            lack of expertise. This could have been prevented, had a
            foreign training been available.

18153223.trustfund:
TF022983-SIDA CTF FOR ENVIRONMENT-ASIA,TF022515-PHRD - AGRICULTURE
            ENVIRONMENT/FORESTRY II,TF033291-PAKISTAN - PUNJAB FOREST SECTOR

repnme.cdata!: Pakistan - Punjab Forest Sector Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Punjab Forest Sector Development
            Project will promote sustainable land use in rural areas of
            Punjab by redirecting public sector involvement towards the
            expansion of agro-forestry production systems and the
            rehabilitation of degraded range and scrub land. The project
            will inter alia support the following components: (a)
            institutional development; (b) farm forestry expansion; and
            (c) social range and scrub forest rehabilitation.
